description: Requests a description of a specified set of apps. Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a Show, Deploy, or Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information about user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

parameters.name: AppIds
parameters.description: An array of app IDs for the apps to be described. If you use this parameter, DescribeApps returns a description of the specified apps. Otherwise, it returns a description of every app. (string) ---

nested_items.name: Apps
nested_items.description: An array of App objects that describe the specified apps.

nested_items.name: AppId
nested_items.description: The app ID.

nested_items.name: StackId
nested_items.description: The app stack ID.

nested_items.name: Shortname
nested_items.description: The app's short name.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The app name.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description of the app.

nested_items.name: DataSources
nested_items.description: The app's data sources.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The data source's type, AutoSelectOpsworksMysqlInstance, OpsworksMysqlInstance, RdsDbInstance, or None.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The data source's ARN.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: The database name.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The app type.

nested_items.name: AppSource
nested_items.description: A Source object that describes the app repository.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The repository type.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The source URL. The following is an example of an Amazon S3 source URL: https://s3.amazonaws.com/opsworks-demo-bucket/opsworks_cookbook_demo.tar.gz.

nested_items.name: Username
nested_items.description: This parameter depends on the repository type.
For Amazon S3 bundles, set Username to the appropriate IAM access key ID.
For HTTP bundles, Git repositories, and Subversion repositories, set Username to the user name.

nested_items.name: Password
nested_items.description: When included in a request, the parameter depends on the repository type.
For Amazon S3 bundles, set Password to the appropriate IAM secret access key.
For HTTP bundles and Subversion repositories, set Password to the password.

nested_items.name: SshKey
nested_items.description: In requests, the repository's SSH key.

nested_items.name: Revision
nested_items.description: The application's version. OpsWorks Stacks enables you to easily deploy new versions of an application. One of the simplest approaches is to have branches or revisions in your repository that represent different versions that can potentially be deployed.

nested_items.name: Domains
nested_items.description: The app vhost settings with multiple domains separated by commas. For example: 'www.example.com, example.com'
(string) ---

nested_items.name: EnableSsl
nested_items.description: Whether to enable SSL for the app.

nested_items.name: SslConfiguration
nested_items.description: An SslConfiguration object with the SSL configuration.

nested_items.name: Certificate
nested_items.description: The contents of the certificate's domain.crt file.

nested_items.name: PrivateKey
nested_items.description: The private key; the contents of the certificate's domain.kex file.

nested_items.name: Chain
nested_items.description: Optional. Can be used to specify an intermediate certificate authority key or client authentication.

nested_items.name: Attributes
nested_items.description: The stack attributes.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: When the app was created.

nested_items.name: Environment
nested_items.description: An array of EnvironmentVariable objects that specify environment variables to be associated with the app. After you deploy the app, these variables are defined on the associated app server instances. For more information, see Environment Variables.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: (Required) The environment variable's name, which can consist of up to 64 characters and must be specified. The name can contain upper- and lowercase letters, numbers, and underscores (_), but it must start with a letter or underscore.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: (Optional) The environment variable's value, which can be left empty. If you specify a value, it can contain up to 256 characters, which must all be printable.

nested_items.name: Secure
nested_items.description: (Optional) Whether the variable's value is returned by the  DescribeApps action. To hide an environment variable's value, set Secure to true. DescribeApps returns *****FILTERED***** instead of the actual value. The default value for Secure is false.
